channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Powell didn’t just refuse to deliver a rate cut—he also hinted a raise could have been on the cards
item.description: Powell put a cat among the pigeons by suggesting he was minded to "look through" tariff-induced inflation by not increasing interest rates.

item.title: The Fed’s Powell said the phrase ‘downside risks’ six times in his press conference yesterday—is that bad news for tomorrow’s jobs number?
item.description: The jobs number (nonfarm payrolls, to give its technical name) is due out tomorrow. Expect stocks to react strongly if it comes in weak.

item.title: Inside Biden confidante Steve Ricchetti's 'combative' eight-hour grilling in House Oversight cover-up probe
item.description: Former Biden aide Steve Ricchetti spoke with House investigators for roughly eight hours on Wednesday.

item.title: Apparent AI mistakes force two judges to retract separate rulings
item.description: Two U.S. district judges replaced court orders due to inaccurate case details and hallucinated quotes in legal submissions, highlighting AI risks in l...

item.title: I’m a cybersecurity CEO who advises over 9,000 agencies and Sam Altman is wrong that the AI fraud crisis is coming—it’s already here
item.description: We may soon recognize a "Moore's Law"-style principle for AI that I call “Altman’s Law”: every 180 days, AI capabilities double.

item.title: Trump announces trade deal with South Korea

item.title: Dems Claim Republicans Are ‘Rigging’ Midterms After Crucifying Anyone Who Used The Word ‘Rigged’ In 2020
item.description: Newsom once tweeted at Trump that 'nothing is rigged.'

item.title: UnitedHealth Group didn’t just miss earnings, it did something far worse
item.description: In less than a month, this corporate giant had lost more than half its value.

item.title: Democrat moves to block Trump admin from using military drones to monitor protests after LA riots
item.description: A progressive House Democrat is introducing a bill to block the Trump administration from using military-grade drones to surveil protests.

item.title: No Hope for a NASA Revival
item.description: It’s not just red tape holding back government-funded exploration and innovation. It’s a new cultural pessimism about the future.

item.title: CFOs chart a course for crypto in corporate finance
item.description: Despite some concerns, finance chiefs are already making plans to adopt crypto, according to Deloitte.

item.title: The Hidden Costs of Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Imposing tariffs diverts resources to lobbying efforts that could have been used for productive purposes.

item.title: The Smithsonian Should Sue but Won’t, the Bayeux Tapestry Shouldn’t Travel but Will
item.description: Also, the Ford Foundation should return to Detroit but won’t — all defying your art critic’s good sense.
